item.title: Replicate research studies for knowledge development
item.description: Forecasting stock returns Forecasting stock returns (Rapach and Zhou, 2013) Download data.xlsx Monthly U.S. equity premium out-of-sample forecasting results based on individual economic variables with unrestricted and Predictive regression forecasts with Campbell and Thompson (2008). Download R code.xlsx View post International Stock-Return Predictability (Rapach, Strauss and Zhou, 2013) Download data.xlsx Benchmark predictive regression model estimation from 1980:02 to 2010:12. The countries are Australia, Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, Netherlands, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom and United States.

item.title: Economic data in motion
item.description: if(!require("pacman")) install.packages("pacman") ## Loading required package: pacman p_load("tidyverse", "tidyquant", "gganimate", "bbplot") tickers <- c("LRHUTTTTFRM156S", "LRHUTTTTDEM156S", "LRHUTTTTUSM156S", "LRHUTTTTJPM156S") countries_name <- c("France", "Germany", "United States", "Japan") unemployment_lst <- list() for(i in seq_along(tickers)){ unemployment_lst[[i]] <- tq_get(tickers[i], get = "economic.data", from = "2000-01-01", to = "2018-11-01") %>% mutate(symbol = countries_name[i]) } unemployment_tbl <- do.call(rbind, unemployment_lst) p <- unemployment_tbl %>% ggplot(aes(x = date, y = price, fill = symbol)) + geom_area(stat="identity") + labs(title = "Harmonized Unemployment Rate: Total: All Persons", subtitle = "France, Germany, Japan and United States", y = "Unemployment", x = "Year") + scale_fill_discrete(name = " ") + theme_tq() + facet_wrap(~symbol, ncol = 2) p + transition_reveal(date) + shadow_mark()

item.title: Finanzas I ➡️ 📈 + 🇪🇸
item.description: Material de clases Apunte: Introducción a las finanzas quantitativas Este apunte es una introducción a las finanzas quantitativas (data science applied to finance) usando el lenguaje R. Si bien fue construido a partir de las ayudantías practicas para el curso de Finanzas I, como autor espero que sea algo más grande. Está en construcción, por ende, cualquier sugerencia y/o comentarios son bienvenidos. Apunte Source Code
